reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is 1 block from the beach corner of Hayarkon Street,and 1 block north of the Opera Tower. But there are other hotels equally as convenient. And Hayarkon Street is not so attractive. Breakfast was good, but not the fabulous Israeli breakfast we have seen in other hotels. Room was small, and bath was very small. And why can't Israeli's get the shower stall design correct so that water stays in the shower, not on the floor? Hallways are not carpeted.
reviews.title: Not sure why you would stay here
friendly - but small
reviews.text: The good points are free wifi, which is great! And the front desk was super helpful in making dinner recommendations and reservations. Hotel manager easily knew the location of some obscure shops, which we appreciated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean. Front desk staff was very helpful - with directions, recommendations on restaurants and tours. The breakfast was very good - not as much selection as the larger hotels, but the quality was as good or better.
reviews.title: Good Deal Good Location Great Breakfast
Helpful
reviews.text: The rooms are small - not a shock as compared to typical big city hotels, but they are much smaller than is availible at the larger beachfront hotels in Tel Aviv. I also stayed at the Renaissance and the room was much larger, especially the bathroom and shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower at the De La Mer is like a phone booth (if anyone remembers those). I was in the smallest room, a single - so I am sure there are slightly larger rooms available.
reviews.title: Good Time
Don't get what the big deal is all about
reviews.text: I don't get the raving reviews. We love small hotels, but this one was just not good. Smallest room I've ever been in (and I have been to small rooms!) Barely enough room to walk around the bed. Feng Shui? Small, cramped, no ambiance of any kind. Small balcony, more than half of which was taken up by the AC. See others' notes about the shower stall - if you need to wash your lower extremities, you can't do in the stall. Worn furniture and fixtures. Stayed in room 110 ( I think) - avoid at all costs. Hopefully others are better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're thinking "small&elegant" - this hotel is not. It's just small and cheap. Nothing wrong with that, but "boutique" and "feng shui" do not describe this hotel well. Decent to crash in for a night or two, but don't expect much. It's a small, outdated hotel in decent location best suited for a traveler on a tight budget. Don't pay any mind to "boutique" and "feng shui" and other fluff.
reviews.title: Nothing but good things to say about De La Mer!

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned home after a 9 day stay at this little hotel. I cannot say enough good things about it! We stayed in one of the oceanview suites. It was clean, comfortable and roomy. It's true that there is a parking lot in between the hotel and the beach, but this in no way obstructed nor detracted from our view.
reviews.title: Great place, but aging

likes.liked: — Small size; very close to beach

reviews.title: Don't stay at Hotel DeLaMar
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel was unlike any that I have ever encountered anywhere else. They truly cared that everything was to our liking and that we were having a good time. It was like staying in a location run by family...we felt totally embraced. Michael has become a life-long friend to us...he is wonderful! We had some very interesting conversations with this new friend. Shuki made sure that our reservations were straightened out at a museum that we very much wanted to get to. Daniel and Avivit were always helpful in recommending local eateries....and making sure that we were able to get there. The rest of the staff (Natan, Dikla and Yechiel) were also top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast each day was delicious....a nice assortment of interesting foods, and beautifully displayed.
reviews.title: Feel welcome & comfortable at Hotel de la Mer

reviews.text: I join the many other complimentary remarks made about this hotel.
reviews.title: Best in Tel Aviv

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was there for 10 days in late April and I can say, without hesitation, it is the best hotel in Tel Aviv I have ever stayed in - and I've stayed in quite a few over the years.
reviews.title: Wonderful hospitality!

reviews.text: In fact I enjoyed the experience so much that when I was checking out I immediately made another booking for this September, a request graciouly accepted by the friendly front counter staff who even offered me a slight discount. Now that's what I call service!
reviews.title: Nice hotel in convenient location.

reviews.text: On my arrivgal 10 days previously I had been welcomed by the friendly Michel on the front desk who rang my room a few minutes later to see if everything was all right. It was.
reviews.title: Breakfast seems better.......

likes.liked: — attractive public spaces, helpful staff, good breakfast
likes.disliked: — no view in our room, bathtub needed sprucing up

reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, the hotel couldn't be better located, so close as it is to the beach, the restaurants and the local night spots, such as The Pub on Allenby Street, an English-style establishment owned by Scott who once ran a bar by the same name at the corner of Haryarkon Street, not far from the Hotel De La Mer.
reviews.title: Terrible Service

reviews.text: I booked directly with the hotel for 2 nights. They gave me an excellent price, because they had one free room which they wanted to sell.
reviews.title: Good, but with reservations

likes.disliked: — The little annoyances that make the difference betwen a good stay and a great one.

reviews.text: My single room faced the sea, though with a parking lot in between. It was larger than most single rooms usually are, though the shower stall was quite tight.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel for an okay price

reviews.text: During the night there turned out to be problems with the air conditioning, and they weren't able to fix it. The manager offered to change my room, at no extra cost, to a double room on the top floor, which has its own huge terrace. It was a delight.Unfortunately, there is no sun umbrella to allow use of the terrace during the height of the sun hours.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel!

likes.liked: — The level of personal attention from staff, breakfast buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room had no mini bar, but the second one did. Unfortunately, it wasn't very clean.
reviews.title: Small with a personal touch

likes.liked: — Friendly and helpful staff, location, breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Neither room had a hair dryer (though I was told later I could have borrowed one from the reception). Neither shower had a shelf in it to put anything on it. The hotel gives no shampoo or creams, etc. The towels were skimpy.
reviews.title: recommendable

likes.liked: — very central, near buses, markets, shops, sea, cafes, restaurants
likes.disliked: — the view on the parking lots
